DOC.brief_summary: To determine whether specialty training or high volume of operative experience is associated with better clinical outcome and quality-of-life scores.
DOC.brief_title: High Volume Specialty Knee Replacement Surgeons Achieve Better Clinical and Quality-of-Life Scores
DOC.detailed_description: Primary total knee replacements are becoming a commonly performed procedure. Many general orthopaedists can perform large numbers of such surgeries. Thus, we aim to find out if there is value of having surgeons with AR fellowship training to perform primary total knee arthroplasty. This has an implication in the direction of the training of future AR surgeons and in the distribution of operative cases.
DOC.criteria: patients who require total knee arthroplasty seen during the specified period revision total knee arthroplasty unicompartmental or bicompartmental knee arthroplasty
DOC.keyword: clinical outcome scores post total knee arthroplasty
quality of life scores post total knee arthroplasty
